title: Vijayawada
summary: Vijayawada, formerly known as Bezawada,[6][7] is the second largest city in the Indian state of Andhra Pradesh.[8] It is a part of the de facto state capital region Amaravati. It lies on the banks of Krishna river surrounded by the hills of Eastern Ghats[9] known as Indrakeeladri Hills[9] in Krishna district. It geographically lies on the center spot of Andhra Pradesh.[10] The city has been described as the commercial, political, and educational capital of Andhra Pradesh,[10] second largest city in Andhra Pradesh and is one of the fastest growing urban areas in India.[11][12]
